thread.title: JLL's buying St. Paul-based Oak Grove Capital
thread.title_full: JLL's buying St. Paul-based Oak Grove Capital

title: JLL's buying St. Paul-based Oak Grove Capital
text:
JLL Americas CEO Greg O'Brien Chicago-based JLL says it's acquiring St. Paul-based real estate lender Oak Grove Capital . JLL (NYSE: JLL) said its takeover of the company (formally known as Oak Grove Commercial Mortgage) will be complete by the end of 2015. Oak Grove's 120 employees across the country will join JLL. Oak Grove employees will continue to work at their St. Paul headquarters after the acquisition's completion, JLL spokesperson Heather Filkins said. Oak Grove's capabilities "will expand JLL's market-rate, affordable and senior housing and healthcare financing expertise and complement its multifamily sales and equity services," JLL said in a news release Thursday. “Oak Grove has built a superior reputation and is widely recognized as a leader in credit analysis, underwriting and risk management, as well as asset management and loan servicing," JLL Americas CEO Greg O'Brien said in a prepared statement. "Its complementary culture and deep client relationships will blend seamlessly as we partner together to create a focused approach in the multifamily sector.” JLL provides management and real estate outsourcing services for a 3.4 billion-square-foot portfolio and completed $118 billion in sales, acquisitions and finance transactions in 2014. The firm reported annual fee revenue of $4.7 billion and gross revenue of $5.4 billion. It has more than 230 corporate offices, operates in 80 countries and employs 58,000 people around the globe. Combined, JLL and Oak Grove will service more than $14 billion of loans annually.
